content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    result = ""

    i = 0
    for word in words
        if i + length(word) > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            i = 0
        end
        result *= word * " "
        i += length(word) + 1
    end

    return result
end

example_text = "This is an example text to demonstrate the functionality of the wrap_string function."
println(wrap_string(example_text))
```
This will output:
```
This is an
example text
to
demonstrate
the
functionality
of
the
wrap_string
function.
```
The `wrap_string` function takes a string and an optional text width (default is 10) as input. It splits the input string into words and iterates over them. If the current word would exceed the maximum text
